nodes.title: 2023-10-04 Weekly Meeting 127 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 127 is happening on Wednesday, October 4, 2023 from 9:00 AM PDT (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat.

Who we are and why we're here:
The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

If youâ€™re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in the ðŸ”ˆ omi-weekly-meeting chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

Agenda:

1.   "420".
2. Oopsie! where is last week's meeting? (Link below but not visible in the [discussions page](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions))? Is this a bug or did a lot happen in the backlog refinement?
3. Feedback on metatraversal
4. Feedback on OMI demo day "interoperable physics in the open metaverse"
5. Monthly OMI demo days: schedule and take ownership. [Hackmd ](https://hackmd.io/@indiebio/OMI-monthly-demo-days)for scheduling and [discussion thread on Discord](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/1149030210503716944).
6. Weekly game nights? 
  e.g. foosball, darts, card games, and beanbags, and a little movie theatre where we show movies. Then we meet there, like a clubhouse, once a week. No agenda, just chillin' together. Maybe in VR chat?
7. Elections.
There will be elections for OMI chairs. MrMetaverse is up for re-election, indiebio has nominated herself for election.
Nominations will be open until <date>
Election will be on <date>
More info on roles of Chairs https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-tasks-audit; 
also: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/157
and https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/165
8. EU research funding cycle open. Do a demo day to see what is out there, match up with people? [Thread on Discord](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/1158355479349702686)
9. Question in Discord about "[different implementations of metaverse engines](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/895065600353792081/1158043241158029402)" - this could be a great demo day topic as well? Or some sort of a thing. Like a youtube debate.
10. OMF collaboration ... should we try work this? As a separate but closely aligned partner, perhaps the commercial side to OMI's grassroots community? 
10.1. Where should OMF focus on (e.g. what working groups)
10.2 Where should the closest collaboration between  OMF and OMI be?
11. Media group needs more integration!

Working group check-ins

- Revisit sending an invitation about growing the glTF spec group, to students

Last week: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/419

3. metatraversal had a good turnout, was a rapid turnover, visited a lot of places. Opportunities to collaborate.
Keyframe was part of the production. Was good, could have been more seamless with integration with Zoom. Also had streamyard going for presentation flow which also showed bottom-third. Integration could have been better, being improved going forwards. VRLand and Upland are creating portal implementations (?).
Keyframe is processing video this week, needs to be shorter than the whole 1hour and will share next week.

4. OMI demo day was good, someone was demo'ing camera control system. Post-production live in event sort of thing, programmatically move cameras and adjust focal length etc.
jin pulled it off, M3 put in a great effort
5. Demo day scheduling, "Wouldn't it be cool if" demo day ... and then we can talk, who is interested, who is doing this, what are the challenges?

6. Movie nights not as good, but background music can work. Being together in a space is good.
Can have crash-cars for those who want to move around.
Metaverse makerspace?
7. Give enough notice on nominations and elections in the coming meetings too. Will update the dates ASAP.

9. All metaverse **engines** have in common to take your assets with you.
So VRchat could be classified as one.
A game engine could be *used* to build a metaverse platform but it is not a engine/platform in itself.
> Need a channel or a FAQ or something to deal with the terminology as it emerges.
10. Could align some of our sessions with OMF. Could allow a mixing zone for conversations to take place...

Working groups:
glTF last week worked on audio stuff.
thanks to antpb for spearheading that.
Proposal submissions open for Interop2024: https://web.dev/interop-2024-proposals/
11. Media group needs calendar added, permissions topost / update website

MSF is creating a library of reference material. sortof adjacent to the museum concept. jimmy to give link for more info.
Could be an opportunity to collaborate in the display or access of these.

nodes.title: 2021-08-25 Weekly Meeting 18 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 18 is happening on Wednesday 2021-08-25 from 9:00 AM PDT - 10:00 AM PDT

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Agenda
   - Welcome new members and attendance
   - [OMI Survey](https://forms.gle/Dxvap4auBGim6JsL9)
   - Working agreements / playbook follow-up
   - Discord Role Bot (#roles in Discord)
   - Website
       - update on iterative development and release strategy
       - call out for website section maintainers and community content
   - glTF Sub Group
       - progress updates
       - call out for extension brainstorming [list](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/7)
       - Khronos 3D Formats Group Liaison
   - Virtual World URIs / omi-world-metadata
        - follow-ups from [2021.08.21 hack-together](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/878654908549713970)
   - World Exploration
       - discoveries from [Tuesday's vket outing](https://discord.com/channels/770382203782692945/852608195972694067)
   - Demo Night coordination follow-up
     - https://forms.gle/CknpQQKNi7ywQu9u5

Add ons: 
  - ...

@humbletim and I were talking and eventually, we may want to look out our Main (formerly known as "Master") backlog at the end of our meetings. This is where we can track what working groups we have, which projects are active, and which are for the future. 

If a topic gets removed from the agenda, it is often forgotten by the next week, because we usually copy and paste the agenda from the previous week. This may cause us to lose track of projects. We could explicitly state "We haven't seen any progress on the OMI place to meet, work, and hang, in about 4 weeks. So I am de-prioritizing #44 from active, to the backlog." And when a new topic gets added, we would explicitly state "We recently accepted proposal #49 and are moving this to active". 

That way when new topics are introduced we can ensure they are tracked/trackable. And when old topics fall to the wayside, we don't forget about them later. 

I am suggesting 5-10 min at the beginning or end of our Wednesday all-hands meetings. 

Thoughts?

Next week, let's start or end our meeting with a quick 15-20 min retro with those who can make it. 
- What has been going well? 
- What could be improved? 
- What could we do different moving forward? 

We will take 5 min to answer in a figjam board. And review for a timeboxed 10-15 minutes. We feed on actionable feedback.

nodes.name: Consistently deliver value
nodes.description: We incrementally discover and deliver  value with intent

nodes.title: 2021-08-18 Weekly Meeting 17 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 17 is happening on Wednesday 2021-08-18 from 9:00 AM PDT - 10:00 AM PDT

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Agenda
   - Screenshot attendance, Welcome new members, review process for Submission and forming working groups
   - Working agreements / playbook follow-up
       - A quick statement from Jesse 
   - Website
       - A group is getting together this Sunday 8/22/21 at 10am PDT / 1pm EDT, to apply some of our recent changes to the existing site, and get a new iteration live. 
   - glTF Sub Group
       - OMI Audio Emitter Extension
       - Blender Tooling
       - Hubs -> OMI glTF Transform CLI
       - Robert created a brainstorming [list](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/7) 
   - Discord Bot
       - progress update
   - World Exploration
       - schedule next outing
   - First Lightning Talk (prev Demo Days) event (~~August 26~~)
       - tentative event time moving to September
       - [sign-up form](https://forms.gle/EsXXnzUG2eaXQpxo7)
       - https://github.com/omigroup/OMI/issues/59
   - Screenshot end attendance (for those who arrived late) 

Add ons: 
- Virtual World URIs


Notes for todays session are available on [hackmd](https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-081821)

quick follow-up on Virtual World URIs https://github.com/omigroup/OMI/discussions/23 discussion:
  - @jamesjackson's comment re: Open AR Cloud and the idea of considering AR locations similar to other virtualized world addresses
  - @jfenton's ideas around creating a neutral system app to help users actually consume virtual world URIs locally https://github.com/omigroup/OMI/discussions/23#discussioncomment-1188604
  - @technobaboo ideas around potential overlap with Stellar Mesh/Constellation
  - ... discuss relevant next steps (schedule a focused brainstorming meeting? is there sufficient interest to propose a subgroup?)

I started a [list](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/7) of possible glTF extensions for our community to work on next. I'd love more suggestions and input on the proposals I've made.

Re: Website 

A group is getting together this Sunday 8/22/21 at 10am PDT / 1pm EDT, to apply some of our recent changes to the existing site, and get a new iteration live. We can iterate on it from there, but probably have more than enough to work with for now.
Notes for todays session are started [on hackmd](https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-081821)

nodes.title: 2021-08-11 Weekly Meeting 16 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 16 is happening on Wednesday 2021-08-11 from 9:00 AM PDT - 10:00 AM PDT

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Agenda
- Welcome new members, review process for Submission and forming working groups 
- Website
- glTF Sub Group
  - OMI Audio Emitter Extension
  - Blender Tooling
  - Hubs -> OMI glTF Transform CLI
- Discord Bot
- World Exploration Meetup Recap
- Demo Days
- Stellar Mesh

Add ons: 
- Evo suggested we talk about the nvidia announcement regarding [omniverse](https://80.lv/articles/nvidia-announces-a-major-expansion-of-nvidia-omniverse/)

Key part of nVidia Omniverse is the use of Pixar Universal Scene Description (USD) as the exchange format. They announced this week that Blender will support it.  They have bunch of announcements this week, including live talk while this meeting is happening (i think)
Don't forget showing off OMI-chan to everyone and asking for feedback, should take ~5 minutes

### Working agreements 
- if your working group would like to create a team working agreement, please reach out to Jesse (@mrmetaverse) for facilitation (if needed)
- We have found that creating a working agreement for all of OMI may not be ideal, as working agreements are best used for teams working on a specific topic. So for the gltf working group, or the upcoming stellar mesh working group, I recommend we draft working agreements that fit each teams. For example, we may have a working group consist mainly of people in Europe and they may want to establish standard working hours, or a standard toolset for workshops, etc. 
- Working agreements help strengthen team dynamics, and provide a psychologically safe place for all to participate. 
- Working agreements are also ideal for establish ceremony cadence, i.e. if your team wants to follow Scrum, you may want to establish a daily standup meeting time, a demo day, and a backlog refinement. But if your team doesn't want to use scrum, you may want to establish kanban or some other method of sharing and tracking work. 
- The most important part is that we should know how work gets done, how to get involved, and how to respect each other. 
-
Notes for todays session are started here on [hackmd](https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-081121)
